Text: REPUBLICANS RALLY: Grassley Vows to Help Susan Collins ëKeep Her SeatíSen. Chuck Grassley pledged to help raise funds for Sen. Susan Collins ahead of the 2018 midterm elections this week; vowing to aid his GOP colleague from vicious, well-financed liberal attacks in the aftermath of her ìyesî vote on Judge Brett Kavanaugh.Grassley described Collinsí treatment following the vote as ìabsolutely abominable,î adding ìIt just goes to show you how narrow the thinking of the opposition to Kavanaugh was that they would say those extremist [Ö] positions about a person who has been with them most of the time.îSeveral groups have launched anti-Collins campaigns to flip her Senate seat; raising over $3 million to finance their efforts.ìIím going to help raise $3 million to match that,î Grassley pledged.Never let Collins have a moment of peace in public again.ó kat calvin (@KatCalvinLA) October 5, 2018Collins has received rave reviews from left-wing activists in the past, particularly for her ìnoî vote on repealing and replacing Obamacare. Now, sheís being described by radical liberals as a ìrape apologistî and ìtraitor.îh/t Town Hall

GRASSLEY: Dems Were ëDiggingí for Kavanaugh Dirt on the ëDay of the VoteíChair of the Senate Judiciary Committee Chuck Grassley slammed his Democratic colleagues Tuesday evening; saying liberal legislators were actively ìdigging aroundî for dirt on Judge Brett Kavanaugh the day he was confirmed.Grassley was speaking with Fox News when he revealed the left-wing lawmakersí desperate attempts to derail and delay Kavanaughís nomination process.Sen. @ChuckGrassley on Justice Kavanaugh: "Even on the day that he was going to be voted to the Supreme Court, there were still people digging around to find some reason that this guy shouldn't be on the court." #TheStory pic.twitter.com/UkrxZZii5yó Fox News (@FoxNews) October 9, 2018ìEvery effort thatís been made in the last month has been to detract from his outstanding qualifications and academic background,î said Grassley.ìEven on the day that [Kavanaugh] was going to be voted to the Supreme Court, there were still people digging around to find some reason that this guy shouldnít be on the court,î Grassley†told Fox News.

IT BEGINS: Liberal Rep. Promises Kavanaugh Probe Should Dems Win MidtermsThe House Democrat in-line to chair the Judiciary Committee if his party retakes control of Congress vowed to launch a series of probes against Justice Brett Kavanaugh this week; calling for investigations into ìsexual misconductî and ìperjuryî immediately after the midterm elections.New York Democratic Rep. Jerrold Nadler raised eyebrows throughout Washington when he refused to discount a series of probes against the newest Supreme Court Justice; saying the FBI may have ìwhitewashedî their investigation into Kavanaugh.ìIt is not something we are eager to do,î Nadler said in a recent interview jus before Kavanaughís confirmation vote Saturday. ìBut the Senate having failed to do its proper constitutionally mandated job of advise and consent, we are going to have to do something to provide a check and balance, to protect the rule of law and to protect the legitimacy of one of our most important institutions.îìHe said that if Democrats took power, he would expect the committee to immediately subpoena records from the White House and the F.B.I., which conducted an abbreviated supplemental background investigation into two of the misconduct claims,î added the New York Times.Read the full story here.

JUSTICE KAVANAUGH: Brett Kavanaugh Confirmed to United States Supreme CourtThe United States Senate voted to confirm Judge Brett Kavanaugh to the Supreme Court Saturday; ending weeks of speculation surrounding the Justiceís political future after 11th hour allegations threatened to derail his nomination.Kavanaughís fierce confirmation battle came to an end Friday when GOP Sen. Susan Collins voted to advance the judgeís nomination; calling the overt political ìsmear campaignî orchestrated to delay the process a ìnational disgrace.î Democratic Sen. Joe Manchin confirmed his ìyesî vote just moments later.Saturdayís final vote was 50 ñ 48.Very proud of the U.S. Senate for voting ìYESî to advance the nomination of Judge Brett Kavanaugh!ó Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) October 5, 2018Judge Brett Kavanaugh is President Trumpís second Supreme Court appointment in just two years.This is a developing story. Check back for updates.

WARREN: Kavanaugh ëOne Step Away,í Time to ëProtestí With ëEverything Weíve GotíSen. Elizabeth Warren urged her supporters to ìprotestî with ìeverything theyíve gotî this week; calling for widespread demonstrations after the United States Senate voted to advance Judge Brett Kavanaughís nomination towards a full vote this weekend.Warren posted the ominous message on social media Friday, saying the Senate was just ìone step awayî from sending Judge Kavanaugh to the United States Supreme Court.ìThe Senate is 1 step away from confirming Brett Kavanaugh ñ but we still have a chance to stop him. Raise your voice NOW. Call & text your friends. Show up in-person. Protest. Post. Tweet. Speak out every way you can. Itís time to own our anger & give it everything weíve got,î she tweeted.The Senate is 1 step away from confirming Brett Kavanaugh ñ but we still have a chance to stop him.Raise your voice NOW. Call & text your friends. Show up in-person. Protest. Post. Tweet. Speak out every way you can.Itís time to own our anger & give it everything weíve got.ó Elizabeth Warren (@elizabethforma) October 5, 2018The firebrand senatorís comments come just a day after hundreds of left-wing activists stormed the Senate office building; demanding legislators ìcancel Kavanaughî and ìvote noî during Saturdayís historic vote.

WATCH: NYC Students Weigh in on Kavanaugh Confirmation, US ConstitutionAfter weeks of desperate Democratic efforts to derail and delay Judge Brett Kavanaughís confirmation process, filmmaker Ami Horowitz took to the streets of the Big Apple to see what real New Yorkers think of the potential Supreme Court Justice.Horowitz spoke with students at college campuses across the city; asking them to weigh-in on Kavanaugh, President Trump, and the state of the nation.ìWe shot outside some of New York Cityís college campuses to get a sense of what they thought of the Brett Kavanaugh hearing,î said Horowitz.ìI donít like him. F*** Trump!î screamed one student. ìUgh, he sucks!îìI donít support the nomination of Brett Kavanaugh because I support human rights,î added another.Watch Horowitzí revealing footage above.

JUDGMENT DAY: Kavanaugh, Ford to Testify Before Congress ThursdayJudge Brett Kavanaugh and Dr. Christine Ford are set to testify Thursday before the Senate Judiciary Committee; setting the stage for a high-stakes showdown as last-minute revelations surprised Congressional leaders.According to Fox News, 11th hour revelations threw Thursdayís hearings into crisis mode; with one potential accuser surfacing Wednesday evening and one individual coming-forward claiming Dr. Ford may have confused Kavanaugh for himself.ìThe proceedings may be upended by late-breaking developments: In a statement released Wednesday evening, Judiciary Committee Republicans revealed that on Monday, they conducted their ëfirst interview with a man who believes he, not Judge Kavanaugh, had the encounter with Dr. Ford in 1982 that is the basis of his [sic] complaint.í They conducted a second interview the next day,î writes Fox.The hearings come days after Sen. Dianne Feinstein upended Kavanaughís confirmation process; abruptly revealing she had sent a letter to the FBI containing allegations of sexual misconduct during the judgeís time in high school.Read the full report at Fox News.

UPDATE: Judge Kavanaugh Releases Full Opening Statement for Senate HearingJudge Brett Kavanaugh released his official opening statement to be delivered before the Senate Judiciary Committee Thursday; saying ìsexual assault is horrificî and adding recent allegations against the potential Supreme Court Justice are ìinconsistent with the rest of his life.îKavanaugh disclosed the statement Wednesday afternoon, just hours after a new accuser claimed the judge and his friends were present at multiple parties in the early 1980s where widespread sexual assault occurred on a routine basis.Read Kavanaughís full opening statement below:Mr. Chairman, Ranking Member Feinstein, and Members of the Committee: Eleven days ago, Dr. Ford publicly accused me of committing a serious wrong more than 36 years ago when we were both in high school. I denied the allegation immediately, unequivocally, and categorically. The next day, I told this Committee that I wanted to testify as soon as possible, under oath, to clear my name.Over the past few days, other false and uncorroborated accusations have been aired. There has been a frenzy to come up with something-anything, no matter how far-fetched or odious-that will block a vote on my nomination. These are last-minute smears, pure and simple. They debase our public discourse. And the consequences extend beyond any one nomination. Such grotesque and obvious character assassination-if allowed to succeed-will dissuade competent and good people of all political persuasions from serving our country.As I told this Committee the last time I appeared before you, a federal judge must be independent, not swayed by public or political pressure. That is the kind of judge I am and will always be. I will not be intimidated into withdrawing from this process. This effort to destroy my good name will not drive me out. The vile threats of violence against my family will not drive me out. I am here this morning to answer these allegations and to tell the truth. And the truth is that I have never sexually assaulted anyone-not in high school, not in college, not ever.Sexual assault is horrific. It is morally wrong. It is illegal. It is contrary to my religious faith. And it contradicts the core promise of this Nation that all people are created equal and entitled to be treated with dignity and respect. Allegations of sexual assault†must be taken seriously. Those who make allegations deserve to be heard. The subject of allegations also deserves to be heard. Due process is a foundation of the American rule of law.Dr. Fordís allegation dates back more than 36 years, to a party that she says occurred during our time in high school. I spent most of my time in high school focused on academics, sports, church, and service. But I was not perfect in those days, just as I am not perfect today. I drank beer with my friends, usually on weekends. Sometimes I had too many. In retrospect, I said and did things in high school that make me cringe now. But thatís not why we are here today. What Iíve been accused of is far more serious than juvenile misbehavior. I never did anything remotely resembling what Dr. Ford describes.The allegation of misconduct is completely inconsistent with the rest of my life. The record of my life, from my days in grade school through the present day, shows that I have always promoted the equality and dignity of women.I categorically and unequivocally deny the allegation against me by Dr. Ford. I never had any sexual or physical encounter of any kind with Dr. Ford. I am not questioning that Dr. Ford may have been sexually assaulted by some person in someplace at some time. But I have never done that to her or to anyone. I am innocent of this charge.

GRAHAM SPEAKS: The Senator Weighs-in on Latest Accusation Against Brett KavanaughSen. Lindsey Graham released a public statement Wednesday afternoon regarding the latest accusations against Judge Brett Kavanaugh; saying the last-minute revelation ìhas just taken this debacle to an even lower level.îGrahamís comments come just hours after Michael Avenatti released the name and allegations from his newest client; claiming Kavanaugh and his friends routinely engaged in sexual assaults during high school parties in the early 1980s.ìJudge Kavanaugh has just emphatically denied the recent allegation being levied by Michael Avenatti and his client. He says he does not know the woman in question and emphatically denies the accusations. I would remind everyone that dozens of women who knew Judge Kavanaugh during the time period in question completely vouch for his good character,î writes Sen. Graham.ìFrom my view, just when you thought it couldnít get any worse, it just did. The lawyer to porn stars has just taken this debacle to an even lower level. I hope people will be highly suspicious of this allegation presented by Michael Avenatti,î he adds.Read Grahamís full statement below:ìJudge Kavanaugh has just emphatically denied the recent allegation being levied by Michael Avenatti and his client. He says he does not know the woman in question and emphatically denies the accusations. I would remind everyone that dozens of women who knew Judge Kavanaugh during the time period in question completely vouch for his good character.ìMr. Avenatti first tweeted†Sunday†night that he had new and explosive information, and he was immediately contacted by the Senate Judiciary Committee to provide information. He has chosen to release these claims the day before Mrs. Fordís hearing and two days before a vote.ìFrom my view, just when you thought it couldnít get any worse, it just did. The lawyer to porn stars has just taken this debacle to an even lower level. I hope people will be highly suspicious of this allegation presented by Michael Avenatti.ìI have a difficult time believing any person would continue to go to ñ according to the affidavit ñ ten parties over a two-year period where women were routinely gang raped and not report it.† I also find it curious these charges were not brought forward until 2018, two days before a confirmation vote.†ìWhy would any reasonable person continue to hang around people like this?† Why would any person continue to put their friends and themselves in danger? Isnít there some duty to warn others?†ìThis is outrageous, internally inconsistent, and I hope the U.S. Senate will see this for the smear campaign that it is.ìIt is outrageous to suggest that Brett Kavanaugh at any time in his life behaved this way. His life is inconsistent with any of these allegations. All women who have worked with and for Brett Kavanaugh when he was in a position of power have nothing but glowing things to say about the way he has conducted himself.†ìThis is a decent man who has lived an honorable life and is being smeared by the likes of Michael Avenatti.ìI very much believe in allowing people to be heard. But I am not going to be played, and Iím not going to have my intelligence insulted by the Michael Avenattis of the world. I will not be a participant in wholesale character assassination that defies credibility.ìIf Republicans bail out on this good man because of the smears and character assassination perpetrated by Michael Avenatti, we deserve our fate.î

UPDATE: Kavanaugh Speaks Out, Says He ëWill Not be Intimidatedí into WithdrawingSupreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh released a public statement Monday regarding allegations of sexual misconduct against the judge during his time in high school and college; saying he refuses to be ìintimidatedî into ìwithdrawing from this process.îThe potential Justice penned a letter to the Senate Judiciary Committee Monday afternoon; expressing his willingness to testify before Congress and address these ìsmearsî publicly.ìThese are smears, pure and simple. And they debase our public discourse. But they are also a threat to any man or woman who wishes to serve our country. Such grotesque and obvious character assassinationóif allowed to succeedówill dissuade competent and good people of all political persuasions from service,î writes Kavanaugh.ìI will not be intimidated into withdrawing from this process. The coordinated effort to destroy my good name will not drive me out,î he adds. ìThe vile threats of violence against my family will not drive me out. The last- minute character assassination will not succeed.îRead Kavanaughís full statement here.

GRASSLEY: Kavanaugh Hearings Will be CANCELED if Accuser Fails to Show UpSenate Judiciary Chairman Chuck Grassley drew a line in the sand regarding Brett Kavanaughís sexual misconduct hearings Tuesday, saying he plans to cancel the entire event should his accuser fail to ìshow up.îGrassley was speaking with Hugh Hewitt Tuesday when he confirmed his office has reached out to Christine Blasey Ford ìthree or four timesî in the last 36 hours but have so far failed to hear from her† or her attorney.ìWe have reached out to her in the last 36 hours three or four times by email and we have not heard from them, and it kind of raises the question, do they want to come to the public hearing or not?î said Grassley.ìWhat would be the purpose of the hearing if Dr. Ford doesnít want to respond?î he asked.Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell echoed Grassleyís comments Tuesday, saying ìMonday is her opportunityî to address Congressional leaders.Read the full story at Fox News.

PRESIDENT TRUMP: Democrats Should Have Released Kavanaugh Allegations ëA Lot SooneríPresident Trump weighed-in Monday on allegations of sexual misconduct surrounding his Supreme Court nominee, saying Judge Kavanaugh is ìone of the finest peopleî heís ever known and the government will ìgo through a processî to make sure ìeverything is just rightî before his confirmation.The President was speaking with reporters at the White House when he was asked to comment on Kavanaughís nomination process; adding he wished Sen. Feinstein had released the information ìa lot sooner.îTrump calls Kavanaugh ìone of the finest people that Iíve ever knownî whoís ìnever had even a little blemish on his record,î adding ìwe want to go through a full processî #tictocnews pic.twitter.com/82NTLcDJPzó TicToc by Bloomberg (@tictoc) September 17, 2018ìJudge Kavanaugh is one of the finest people that Iíve ever known [Ö] Never even had a little blemish on his record,î said Trump.ìHe is somebody very special, At the same time we want to go through a process, we want to make sure everything is just right. I wish the Democrats could have done this a lot sooner, because they had this information for many months, and they shouldnít have waited,î he added.

GRASSLEY SPEAKS: Senate Judiciary Chairman Releases Kavanaugh StatementChairman of the Senate Judiciary Committee Chuck Grassley released a statement regarding President Trumpís pick to join the Supreme Court Monday afternoon; saying Brett Kavanaughís accuser ìdeserves to be heardî in an ìappropriate manner.îGrassley officially commented on the growing controversy just days after Sen. Dianne Feinstein disclosed a letter sent to the FBI that contained allegations of sexual misconduct when Kavanaugh attended high school approximately 35 years ago.ìAnyone who comes forward as Dr. Ford has deserves to be heard, so I will continue working on a way to hear her out in an appropriate,†precedented and respectful manner,î said the statement from Grassleyís office.The Senator added the Judiciary Committee will be ìworking diligently to get to the bottom of these claims.îìThe standard procedure for updates to any nomineeís background investigation file is to conduct separate follow-up calls with relevant parties,î said the statement.Read the full report at the Hill.

DIANNEíS CURVEBALL: Sen. Feinstein Sends ëSECRET LETTERí to FBI About Kavanaughís ConfirmationDemocratic Senator Dianne Feinstein stunned her Congressional colleagues Thursday; publicly stating she sent a mysterious letter to the FBI regarding Brett Kavanaughís confirmation hearing.The liberal lawmakerís comments strangely suggest Trumpís Supreme Court pick could be ìguilty of a crimeî as leading Democrats move to delay the confirmation hearings.ìI have received information from an individual concerning the nomination of Brett Kavanaugh to the Supreme Court,î Feinstein said in her last-minute statement. ìThat individual strongly requested confidentiality, declined to come forward or press the matter further, and I have honored that decision. I have, however, referred the matter to federal investigative authorities.îìThroughout his confirmation process, Judge Kavanaugh has had 65 meetings with senatorsóincluding with Senator Feinsteinósat through over 30 hours of testimony, addressed over 2,000 questions in a public setting and additional questions in a confidential session,î said a White House spokesperson. ìNot until the eve of his confirmation has Sen. Feinstein or anyone raised the specter of new ëinformationí about him.îRead the full story at Fox News.

KAVANAUGH SPEAKS: Trumpís Court Pick BREAKS SILENCE on Feinsteinís LetterJudge Brett Kavanaugh broke his silence Friday regarding Sen. Dianne Feinsteinís last-minute attempt to totally derail his confirmation hearings; categorically denying any accusations contained in the legislatorís mysterious letter.ìI categorically and unequivocally deny this allegation. I did not do this back in high school or at any time,î said Kavanaughís statement.Feinstein stunned her colleagues earlier this week by disclosing a letter she sent to the FBI regarding Kavanaughís confirmation.ìI have received information from an individual concerning the nomination of Brett Kavanaugh to the Supreme Court,î Feinstein said in her surprise statement.The FBI has since declined to open an investigation into the undisclosed allegations; forwarding the letter to the White House to be included in Kavanaughís background check.Read the full story at Fox News.

HANNITY: Democrats Have Already Convicted Brett KavanaughSpeaking during his opening monologue from Las Vegas Thursday night, Hannity weighed-in on the leftís response to allegations of sexual misconduct against Judge Brett Kavanaugh; saying Democrats have already convicted the potential justice ìjust by an accusation.îìThese allegations must be taken seriously; her story deserves to be told. Republicans, President Trump, theyíve been treating this situation with the seriousness it deservesÖ Theyíve re-opened the hearings, theyíve invited the professor to speak before Congress,î said Sean.ìDemocrats donít seem to care. Theyíve thrown a principle we hold so dear -the presumption of innocence- out the window. Theyíve already convicted Kavanaugh based on one allegation. According to them, Kavanaugh is guilty just by an accusation. This is dangerous for every American,î he added.Watch Hannityís opening monologue above.

SEN. WARREN: Brett Kavanaughís Confirmation Process ëIsnít Over YetíSen. Elizabeth Warren weighed-in on Judge Brett Kavanaughís confirmation hearing Friday afternoon; saying the process ìisnít over yetî and accused the potential Supreme Court Justice of ìhiding something.îWarren released the video on social media as the Senate Judiciary Committee voted to advance Kavanaughís nomination, with Sen. Jeff Flake urging GOP leadership to delay the full vote ìone weekî for the FBI to investigate allegations of sexual assault.We believe & stand with Dr. Ford. This isnít over yet. Senator Jeff Flake has called for a one-week delay to allow for an FBI investigation. Weíll fight tooth and nail on the Senate floor to stop Brett Kavanaugh from a lifetime appointment to the Supreme Court. pic.twitter.com/YY8clYefSkó Elizabeth Warren (@elizabethforma) September 28, 2018ìWe believe & stand with Dr. Ford. This isnít over yet. Senator Jeff Flake has called for a one-week delay to allow for an FBI investigation. Weíll fight tooth and nail on the Senate floor to stop Brett Kavanaugh from a lifetime appointment to the Supreme Court,î posted Warren.

HANNITY: Democrat Senators Enter ëFreak-Out Mode' Over Kavanaugh Confirmation Speaking during his opening monologue on ëHannityí Thursday night, Sean weighed-in on the Senateís impending vote on Judge Brett Kavanaugh; saying liberal lawmakers and activists were entering ìfull-on freak-outî mode regarding the potential Supreme Court Justice.ìThe smear merchants on the left are in full-on freak-out mode. Senate Democrats who all demanded an FBI investigation are now trashing that very same investigation,î said Hannity.ìWhile we have exposed the few at the FBI who did abuse their power, weíve always made the point to stand-up for the rank-and-file FBI agentsÖ The FBI acted in a fair, independent manner. Some on the left just donít like the results,î said Sean.ìWhat is the FBI supposed to do? We donít have a location, no date, no physical evidence, no forensic evidence; we donít even know the day of the week,î he added.Watch Hannityís opening monologue above.

IT WAS THAT BAD: Even Justice Ginsburg Says Kavanaugh Hearings Were ëWRONGí for AmericaLiberal Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg weighed-in Wednesday on Brett Kavanaughís wild confirmation hearings; saying the current partisan antics were ìwrongî for the country.Ginsburg was speaking at the George Washington University in Washington, DC this week when she was asked to comment on Kavanaughís confirmation process, simply saying ìthe way it is, is wrong.îìThe way it was, was right,î said Ginsburg. ìThe way it is, is wrong. The atmosphere in í93 was truly bipartisan.îGinsburg was confirmed by the US Senate in 1993 by a bipartisan vote of 96-3 despite widespread concerns regarding her 10 year career on the ACLU board.

HARRIS DEFIANT: Sen. Kamala Harris Asks Supporters to Sign Petition Against KavanaughSen. Kamala Harris shrugged off the recently released FBI report regarding Judge Brett Kavanaugh Thursday; asking her supporters to sign an online petition against the potential Supreme Court Justice.ìWe need just 198,248 more people to reach our new goal of 1.5 million Americans against Brett Kavanaughís nomination to the Supreme Court of the United States. Will you add your name right now?î asked the liberal legislator Thursday morning.We need just 198,248 more people to reach our new goal of 1.5 million Americans against Brett Kavanaughís nomination to the Supreme Court of the United States. Will you add your name right now?ó Kamala Harris (@KamalaHarris) October 4, 2018The left-wing lawmakerís comments echo those of Senators Schumer and Feinstein; who have vowed to fight Kavanaughís nomination despite the FBI finding ìno corroborating evidenceî of sexual misconduct in the early 1980s.

BUSTED: Tennessee Demís Staff Explains THE TRUTH Behind Candidateís Pro-Kavanaugh StanceExplosive undercover footage released by James OíKeefe and Project Veritas Wednesday night showed the stunning depth Democrat politicians are willing to go to retake control of Congress after the 2018 midterm elections.The stunning video shows Tennessee Senate hopeful Phil Bredesenís staff explaining the true motivation behind his alleged ìsupportî for Brett Kavanaugh; admitting ìitís a political moveî and ìthis isnít about anythingî other than appealing to moderate voters in the state.ìNo, itís a political moveÖ He thinks that like weíre down like half a point right now. Itís like really close and weíre losing by a point or two. So he thinks that if like by saying this heís appealing to more moderate republicans and heíll get more of them to vote for us,î said one staffer.ìI was so confused because I just canít believe he would actually vote for him,î asked one journalist.ìHe wouldnít. But heís saying he wouldÖ Which I donít know if it makes it worse or better. No, it makes it better,î added another worker for Bredesenís campaign.Watch the stunning video above.

NATIONAL ANGER: Poll Shows 40% of DEMS Consider Kavanaugh Confirmation a ëNational DisgraceíA stunning new survey published by Rasmussen Reports this week finds a growing number of Democrats consider Brett Kavanaughís nomination process a ìnational disgrace,î reports the Washington Times.ìSeventy-seven percent (77%) of Republicans and 51% of voters not affiliated with either major party agree that Kavanaughís confirmation process has become ëa national disgrace.í Even among Democrats whose senators have been leading the charge against the nominee, 40% agree, and only slightly more (43%) disagree, but 17% are undecided,î writes Rasmussen.ëThis confirmation process has become a national disgrace. The Constitution gives the Senate an important role in the confirmation process, but you have replaced advise and consent with search and destroy,íî sad Kavanaugh during his Congressional testimony last week.The poll comes as GOP leaders and lawmakers advance Kavanaughís confirmation process; potentially holding a full vote on the Supreme Court nominee as early as Saturday morning.Read the full survey here.

GRAHAM SPEAKS: Sen. Lindsey Graham Weighs-in on Flakeís Call for FBI ProbeSen. Lindsey Graham weighed-in on Jeff Flakeís last-minute call for a ëone weekí FBI investigation Friday afternoon; saying the GOP lawmaker was attempting to ìbring the country together.îThe outspoken Kavanaugh-supporter spoke with reporters minutes after the Senate Judiciary Committee voted to advance the judgeís nomination, with Sen. Flake calling on GOP leadership to delay the vote ìone weekî to allow the FBI to probe allegations of sexual misconduct in the early 1980s..@LindseyGrahamSC: "[Senator Jeff Flake is] trying his best to bring the country together and vote the best way he knows how." pic.twitter.com/biwrQ2Kp90ó FOX Business (@FoxBusiness) September 28, 2018ìI donít expect any [Democrats] to vote for the guyÖ Jeffís trying his best to bring the country together in the best way he knows how,î said Graham.

MEET THE CLINTONS: Bill and Hillary to Tour US in 2019Former President Bill Clinton and former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton unveiled their joint tour this week; announcing multiple dates for speaking events across the United States later this year and into 2019.The Clintonís announced the multi-city tour, called ìAn Evening with President Bill Clinton and former Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clintonî Monday, with tickets going on sale Friday at 10am.ìThe Clintons will kick off the trek Nov. 18 in Las Vegas at 5,200-seat Park Theater, the home for Cherís residency and where Lady Gaga will launch her own residency later this year. They will visit Torontoís Scotiabank Arena on Nov. 27, Montrealís Bell Centre on Nov. 28 and Smart Financial Center in Sugar Land, Texas, on Dec. 4,î writes Yahoo News.ìAttendees will have the opportunity to hear one-of-a-kind conversations with the two leaders as they tell their stories from some of the most impactful moments in modern history. From the American presidency to the halls of the Senate and State Department, to one of the United Statesí most controversial and unpredictable presidential elections, they provide a unique perspective on the past, and remarkable insight into where we go from here,î Live Nation said in a statement.Read the full story here.

LIBERAL RAGE: Eric Holder Urges Supporters to ëKICKí GOP VotersFormer Attorney General Eric Holder doubled-down on recent anti-GOP violence across the country this week; urging liberal activists to ìkickî GOP voters when ìthey go low.îHolder was speaking with supporters at an event Tuesday when he seemingly endorsed the scenes of rage and protests taking place throughout the nation in the aftermath of Judge Brett Kavanaughís confirmation.ìItís time for us as Democrats to be as tough as they are, as dedicated as they are, as committed as they are,î said Holder.ìMichelle Obama always said ëWhen they go low, we go high.í No, when they go low, we kick them,î he added as the room burst out in applause.

SOCIALISM USA: Poll Finds ëNEARLY HALFí of Young Democrats Identify as ëSocialistsíA stunning new survey released this week shows nearly half of millennial Democrats self-identify as ìsocialists,î raising serious new questions about the future of the party ahead of the upcoming 2018 midterm elections.The poll, conducted by Buzzfeed, found 47% of Democrats between the ages of 22-37 considered themselves ìsocialistsî or ìDemocratic socialists.î Just 17% of those asked said they ìwould never identify as either.îThe Buzzfeed survey also found that 24% of Republican millennials identified as either a ìsocialistî or ìDemocratic socialist.îThe study was conducted September 21-24 2018 just months after Democratic Socialist Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez defeated a moderate Democratic incumbent; shocking the political world and fueling increased attention for the liberal ideology.Read the full survey here.h/t Washington Examiner
